Reviews.Title: “Excellent Central Hotel with Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nisha R
Reviews.Content: The Hotel extended great hospitality from day one! Very friendly and helpful staff members from Tuncay the General manager, Nesrin the general cordinator and Selbuk at the reception and all the other staff at the hotel - all extremely helpful! Rooms were spacious and clean The hotel is very central with some great attractions within a walking distance........ On the overall we enjoyed our stay at Albatros and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: thisguyfromaisl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Albatros Premier during my visit to Turkey an this hotel is very near to attractions one should not miss while in Istanbul, like the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofya, the Hippodrome, and many others. A mere 10 minutes walk can get you into those attractions form this hotel. The rooms are not bad as well. I took a triple room since we are a family of three and it was not the biggest, but as I said it was clean and a good place to come back to after a hectic day of sightseeing. The breakfast was not all that lavish, but it was enough, and the staff were very friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality hotel, and close to tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at Easter 2012 and were very impressed. Quite easy to find from the Sultanahmet tram stop, room was excellent with comfortable double bed, very good bathroom and shower, air conditioning, and kettle with supply of tea & coffee. There was free use of the safe in the room for valuables. On the advice of the Lonely Planet guide we took a universal sink plug, which is needed in the bathroom for shaving. Staff were all very helpful and friendly, most of them spoke good English. Wide range of food at breakfast, cereals, muesli, yoghurt, fruit, meats & cheese, olives, pasta salad, several different breads & pastries. Had a good meal in the Terrace Restaurant the first evening. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, and a little farther from the Hagia Sophia (Ayasofia) Museum, Grand Bazaar and Topkapi Palace. Tram stop is handy to go to the port at Eminonu for Bosphorus Cruises or ferry crossings, and the tram also goes over the Galata Bridge to Karakoy for modern Istanbul, Taksim Square etc. Note that some of the attractions are closed on Mondays. Just round the corner from the hotel are numerous bars, restaurants and cafes, with a wide range of dishes. For a nightcap we recommend a raki at the Hippodrome bar on Kucuk Aya Sofya Cad, or tea and snacks at the Cafe Mesale in the Arasta Bazaar behind the Blue Mosque, where they have whirling dervish displays.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Vagabondos
Reviews.Content: It was difficult from begining to choose one hotel in Istambul as there are so many, but after one week in Hotel Albatros it feels that we made the rigth choice. We think all personal was very friendly, helpfull and very pleasant. Good breakfast, fresh and varied. No complaints about the cleanning as well. We don't want to seem unfair to the others emplyees, because they were very good professionals as well but we would like to point out two persons of the staff wich we had more regular contact with, Mr. Seluk and Mr Kenan at the reception desk. We also don't forget the efforts that nigth shift staff made to please us with the transmission of one Champions League footboll game. Once again thank you very much for your kindness and professionalism.We definetely recomended this hotel to our friends. See you next time.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD STAFF...”
Reviews.Author: HÄ±sham a
Reviews.Content: thank you all the staff Ä±n the hotel of albatros and specÄ±ally mornÄ±ng breakfast and specÄ±al thanks to gizem and emre WHO WERE VERY GOOD IN THE WORK AND THEIR TREATMENT TO US MANY THANKS

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Moimar22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel sent a car to pick me up from the airport for â‚¬25. The hotel itself is very grand and looks like a typical 4* hotel. The staff is very helpful and the breakfast is also good. The location is excellent and has a taxi stand right outside which is convenient. The reason I haven't given 5/5 is because on the first day they didn't have any hot water. Although this was sorted out, the tap had to run for around a minute for the hot water to come. The tap was also slightly broken so water sprayed in different directions. I asked for a non smoking room but could smell smoke in my room now and again. I could also hear the TV from the next room and could hear their phone ring. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best staff, best value!”
Reviews.Author: irozeira
Reviews.Content: I am a tour guide from Portugal and I use this hotel very often for my groups. I must say that this hotel has a extremely great location in Sultanhamet District just 5 minutes from Blue Mosque or Ayasofia. The staff is extremely helpfull and smilling and the breakfasts are just gorgeous. According to the price i must say this is a great value. I serached around 100 hotels in Sultanhamet and this one was the most helpfull and with the best price/quality relation. The rooms with turkish fancy architecture are full of charm and comfort. I couldnÂ´t be more happy with my research and my choice.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: robert c
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, the location was great for a few reasons. It was very easy to get to from the airport. Just a block off Kennedy Cadessi, so it was easy to find for the taxi(Taksi) drivers. It was very convenient to walk to all the historic mosques and ruins and attractions in Sultanahmet. There is a taxi stand that was always packed with cabs just out the front door. The staff was very helpful with booking tours and handled everything for me including directions to and from places. The room itself was tastefully decorated, a bit pink for my palette though. The bathroom was nice and was comfortable with a stand up shower and free amenities like soap and shampoo. My room was also stocked with a mini-bar and fridge and had a safe and closet for hanging clothes. The breakfast was very nice as well and there was plenty of selections to choose from with fresh breads and pastries and fresh fruit. I did not eat at the restaurant upstairs but heard the views are very nice from the balcony. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and the surrounding neighborhood is full of Ottoman style wooden houses and buildings. All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the price and location... better ones around.”
Reviews.Author: woaishanghai
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks quite good and is priced likewise but there are better hotels around, with better service at lower rates and much better located. At 45 USD, it was okay but this is certainly not worth any more. The room was just enough to fit a double bed and have some space around. Bathroom was clean but staff didn't clean it properly and there was underwear and other toiletries from the previous guests! Some rooms have a balcony overlooking the streets, also not cleaned and was full of ash and cigarette buds. The staff is good at things that are expected of them but very reluctant and stubborn otherwise. While we were there, a couple had booked a room but it was for single use and staff was very unaccommodating charging them almost the room price for breakfast. I think it finally got sorted when the manager arrived, a few hours later after we were done with breakfast. We found this quite frequent in Turkey where staff were helpful only so far as they were getting anything and absolutely rude once payment was done, with exceptions of course. Breakfast is good and certainly the highlight. The hotel is walking distance to attractions nearby, taking about 20 minutes uphill to reach the Sultanahmet tram station. The neighborhood is quite pretty and certainly worth walking around though there's little to do around here. There is another area behind the Blue Mosque/ Arasta Bazaar which has a lot more hotels with bars and restaurants open at nights and, importantly, about half the distance to the tram station. We tried booking our return leg while we were there but staff did not give us the booking.com prices! When we looked around, the hotels behind it, like Deniz Houses for budget and similarly priced Bucolean Palace hotel have much better, bigger rooms with views of the ocean otherwise head closer to the tram station.

Reviews.Title: “A super cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claudinha N
Reviews.Content: For me the Albatros Premier was the best hotel that I stayed when I traveled to Turkey. I went there with my husband. We stayed in several different hotels, during a trip of 14 days. We stayed in 5 stars hotels, but for me, none of them was better than Albatros. There we felt like special people, the treatment of the staff was friendly and polite. The room was clean and with an amazing view. Besides, the location is very good, because the hotel is close to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and is very easy to go to other sites of the city by tram. The style of Albatros matchs to the old city (old europe part).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TulioNaves
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five days at Albatros in past october (2011). The staff is very polite and friendly. The room was clean every day, and the size is better than many four or five star hotels in Istanbul, as Gonen Taksim, for example. Breakfast is excelent. The location is a privilege, close to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Yerebatan Cistern and a variety of stores and souvenir shops. We can walk around and see the unique stile of Old Europe part of Istanbul. The transportation to New Europe, other atraction and port are easy by tram, near to Hotel. ItÂ´s a very good choice, without doubt! When we come back to Turkey will stay in Albatros! Enjoy it! TÃºlio Naves from Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Excellent Service.”
Reviews.Author: ROY A
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Istanbul, Turkey and I chose this hotel because of it`s dainty appearance, an attractive front and a clean facade on Google search.. After spending four days here, I also found that it is very conveniently located in the Sultanahmet area, a walking distance from most of the important tourist attractions like the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Baslika Cisterns, Small Saint Sophia, Islamic Art Museum, Chora Museum, Kumkapi Fishing Restaurants and Grand Bazaar. I didn`t need a cab to visit all these places and had my days filled with interesting sight-seeing. I also have to add that a good hot bath, clean towels and a comfortable bed topped off the excellent sevice and holiday here in Istanbul at the Albatross Premier Hotel, at extremely reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and BEST service!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul for a Business Meeting and I chose Albatros Premier Hotel because a friend of mine told me of this nice Hotel. The location of the Hotel is really perfect, because you find yourself in the middle of the old Istanbul, exactly in the center of Istanbul. The Hotel Director Mr. Topcu was also very welcoming and offered me the best service you can get. When you fly to Istanbul, Albatros Premier Hotel is the right adress! :) Peter McAllister

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Blascaod
Reviews.Content: Thank You for the 4 nights-stay in this very clean, good location and fancy hotel near sea shore and all the tourist attractions in Sultanahmed area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jactravel j
Reviews.Content: The hotel has high class of service. It is closed to all sights. The rooms are clean, the breakfast is fresh!. the staff is very friendly and helpful. I reccomend everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Yuliya, Kazakhstan”
Reviews.Author: Yushkevich
Reviews.Content: I've been there 7 days and I really liked this hotel, especially staff. My room was comfortable, nice and clean. I was excited beautiful view from the top of the hotel. People are friendly and responsitive. The area is quiet. I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Katzmother
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Istanbul and had a wonderful time. The hotel is ideally situated in walking distance of the main attractions. I was with my daughter and we felt safe walking back in the evening. The beds were extremely comfortable. There was a safe in the room, free to use. The shower was efficient but the surround was a little shabby. There was a wide choice of breakfast foods with attentive staff keeping everything topped up. If I return to Istanbul to see the sights I missed, I would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel of istanbul”
Reviews.Author: georgia k
Reviews.Content: i,ve been more than 20 times in istanbul i tried many hotels this hotel i found by chance in internet all was excellent from service all and the photos in website original brekfast very good the rooms very very clean and from roofgarden restaurant excelent i work in a tourist office rent a car in chanea in crete island and i know from good service my company is speed-rentacar.gr my name is georgia kotronaki

Reviews.Title: “Albatros”
Reviews.Author: lorna g
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul and stayed for three nights at the Albatros which I found to be very clean and central for all the major attractions of Istanbul. The hotel has just been refurbished on the outside and looks very elegant. The breakfast room too has had a refit. It also has a lovely rooftop restaurant. I only had breakfast and that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aygun a
Reviews.Content: My trip was very interesting. I liked it very much. I have spent very good time in this hotel. This hotel is very nice. My room was very clean and nice. I had a good view from the window of my room- hotel. . The serves was on high level. The meal in restaurant was very delicious. I can say for sure that I would like to come back again to this hotel. Also I can add about the serves in the restaurant - the food was very good, the meal was very nice and people were very welcome to me.

Reviews.Title: “I highly advice to chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed A
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great as per location, team, and value for money. I really advice this hotel for any visitor to Istanbul whom want to have a pleasant stay in a hotel. From the first moment in the hotel you feel you are well welcomed and you are within a family and all the team are willing to help and advice. Location is fantastic, 5 minutes walking to the sea-side and 10 minutes walking to Sultane Ahmet area were most of historical places located and nice activities. A big thanks to all the hote's team and special thanks to Miss Nesrin Oncel whom adviced us to visit the best places and returants in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel good location...”
Reviews.Author: frank w
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very polite and helpful, the rooms were very comfortable and it was very nice to have coffee and tea available free for guests through out the day. The design of the hotel i liked very much with tasteful renovations of the restaurant area.Sultanahmet very easily location by walk just 3 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Poor and no value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_birmingham90
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be down graded from a 4 star to a 2 star. There was a damp smell within the room. The Bed was hard & uncomfortable. The Air Con was not cooling the room adequetly. The floor was never cleaned and gathered dust which could be visibly seen but never cleaned by the house keeping. Hair on pillows when we first arrived. No kettle in room, no hangers in wardrobe. Staff were not very helpful. Breakfast was appauling!!! worst I've ever experienced. If your a rabbit you'll be fine... Options are olives, yogurt, raisons, dried fruits and watered down juice. And it was the same options everyday! Would not recommend this Hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoudi
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is located in a very beautiful location, it has great amenities and a very helpful staff i recommend this hotel if you are on a short family vacation. It is worth every penny you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend”
Reviews.Author: MariaBham
Reviews.Content: Its a mid range hotel. The rooms are ok but bed was very uncomfortable (as hard as sleeping on the floor) and room wasnt properly cleaned. Dust on the floor and hair in the bed on arrival. Smell of mould in bathroom. Breakfast was continental and served on the roof top terasse. There was no option of eating inside so was freezing cold (happened to be cold and windy, and some mornings rainy). You didnt even get to finish your breakfast before a waiter/waitress took the plate of you, sometimes even before you had started eating and just gone inside to get a cup of coffee! This was very stressful. Staff also unprofessional. Would only stay at this hotel for a rate of 40 euros per night, Its defenitely not worth more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, comfortable room, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: LILLYMumbai_India
Reviews.Content: Came in from Italy for 3 night stay. Had booked this hotel on earlier reviews. Several emails to the hotel prior to arrival went unattended. From airport, ideal to take a cab, which comes to about 35 Turkish Liras. Avoid airport shuttles to hotel, because they are out to fleece passengers. Shuttles are advised for departures, priced at 5 Euros per head. The staff is warm and helpful. The rooms are OK, and amenities are adequate, including tea/ coffee making amenities. Linen is changed daily. The decor is oriental. TV is avoidable. Breakfast is mainly local menu, though eggs, bread and tea/coffee is provided. The location is great, within comfortable walking distance to the must see sights. The tariff is somewhat steep, though apparently most hotels in the vicinity are similarly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: sezercik
Reviews.Content: I admit, the hotel is very close to the highlights Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and what have you. But even this is not worth the price (we paid 250â‚¬ for 3 nights). Room are small (size of the bed plus half a meter to walk) and run down. Bed is very hard and stiff. Airco doesn't work, but makes an awful lot of noice. You have to be in IT to make the TV work, Turkish channels only. Very noisey (we could hear everything our neighbours (on all sides) did or said. We were on the first floor. However, there is no traffic noise.Wifi was working fine. Roof terrace is ok, breakfast is in a anonymous hall. The breakfast itself is quite Turkish, but cheapy Mind: there are no other amenities or services. For the price we paid, it even would have been better to have a much cheaper and better hotel around Taksim or even the Asian side and take a taxi to the old city. However, we only had two days, so we chose this. But we never will again.

Reviews.Title: “The first trip in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ufukChur
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to istanbul. The hotel was really nice. They were looking for me if i had a problem. I could always ask for the way when i was planing for a tour. It was my first trip but not the last one.

Reviews.Title: “Under reconstruction!!!”
Reviews.Author: EsboTilde
Reviews.Content: For the moment I donÂ´t think you should pay full price for the rooms because of the reconstruction that is going on at the hotel. The hotelowner should inform guests about that before the arrival. If we had known about the reconstruction we should have choosen another hotel. As it is now I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, there are plenty of hotels nearby were you can stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL IN A WONDERFUL CITY.”
Reviews.Author: yasirSharjah
Reviews.Content: IN My opinion i have to give them 5star,service like 5star best staff ever seen in any hotel.no1 in cleanliness etc.and this is my 1st hotel iam wriiting a review just because im very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: lektor
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Albatros Premier Hotel with a group of 16 colleagues. Had the most terrible weather: Close to freezing temperatures, the rain was pouring down in buckets, hailing winds. But the rooms were still warm and nice, all trough. Plenty of space, excellent cleaning, good beds, new bedsheets every day, it seemed. Breakfast was quite ok, - but a minus for watered-out juice and only Nescafe. Very welcoming service. The hotel organized a supper for our whole group on short notice Friday night at the terrace restaurant, with ok food. Will certainly come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jinty16
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend with friends where we stayed at Albatros Premier Hotel. The Hotel was really fabulous, phoned the Hotel the night before and they arranged for us to be picked up at airport, and also arranged our return trip. The rooms were very clean, decorated to a high standard, towels and linen top quality, changed every day. The room has, kettle and selection of teas, a well stocked minibar and complimentary shower gel, shampoo, etc also sewing kit, shoe shine kit. The staff at the Hotel wre really great, nothing too much trouble, complimentary drink and welcome meeting on arrival. We went to the Party Night in the roof top restaurant they had brought in Musician and we had a Belly Dancing SHow. It was one of our groups birthday and they appreaded with a cake complete with candles and made a big fuss of her, woderful. The Hotel was very well stuated, only 5 minutes walk from Blue Mosque and 10 minutes from Grand Bazar. We had a really wonderful time and would strongly recommed this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is one amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: theFishers52
Reviews.Content: Our first hotel stay in Turkey and what a find. It is stiuated in the Sultanhamet and close to many attractions. The room was well furnished, clean and breakfast was really tasty with a great selection of food. The staff were so helpful and we were able to maximise our three night stay there and see most of what Istanbul has to offer. A real value for money stay in a boutique style hotel staffed by people you look forward to seeing again. Thank you so much, we will return. Helen & Doug, Tauranga, New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel must visit”
Reviews.Author: youyou107
Reviews.Content: It is realy nice hotel, we spent 2 weeks and we were realy happy, friendly staff, especially the guys of breakfast always smily and helpufull and close to blue mosque, aya sofia, top kapi musium must see, it is in the heart of sultanahmet area, honestly won't regret it at all, Just be carefull about few restaurants because they add extra 10% to the service which is like in way how to rubb money Istanbul is lovely town musssssst seeeee .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect modern day comforts in an impressively beautiful Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SusanHanau
Reviews.Content: I warmly recommend the Albatros Premier Hotel based on the ff. reasons: The oriental comforts of the hotel in modern Istanbul;the perfect proximity to the AyaSofia,blue mosque,Arasta bazaar,taxi stand,City Bus tour starting station, and many other restaurants and hotels.The excellent, friendly and English speaking hotel staff headed by Assistant Mgr.Mr.Tuncay Topcu,Guest Relations Director Ms Nesrin Oncel,Mr Savas Celenk,Mr Ferhat Kaya,Mr Kenan and Mr Omar.The seaview and AyaSofia view from the rooftop breakfast garden. The extremely comfortable and back-friendly orthopedic beds which offer fantastic rest after long and tiring walks around a great city ! The very good value for money and ideal location in the old SultanAhmet district. I actually enjoyed being woken up by the sounds of seagulls and albatrosses in the morning, and hearing the Calls for Prayer from the Mosques. It reminded me of being in the Orient and a different world! Book the ff. tours with Ms.Oncel who can give you great sightseeing tips and advices: the Doubledecker Bus City Tour by PlanTours, the Bosporus Tours, and the Hodjapasha night of Turkish Dances.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bed sheets, helpful and freindly staff and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rashroush
Reviews.Content: The main positive thing about this hotel is the location, its right in the heart of the old city of Istanbul (Sultanahmet) and its very close to all attractions and differerrnt palaces and mosques, beside the tram station is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel, and there are plenty of restaurants and shops in the surrounding area. Breakfast was good, served on the top floor rrestaurant which has a nice terrace, but watch out from the birds (albatros) which can come very close to your table and can literally steal some of your food (they stole some of my cheese !!) I stayed with my husband in this hotel for 4 nights, and when we were about to go to bed, I had noticed some hair on the bed sheets (that didnt belong to us) beside some dirt of "unclear" nature under the pillow, so I called the reception to send someone to change the bed sheets as either the room service did not do thier job properly during the day or they have serious problems with thier washing machines, anyway they changed them and we got to sleep. the next day when I wanted to shower there was a problem with the drainge and the water kept accumulating in the shower and later started flooding out to the bathroom floor, we asked them to send someone to check and fix it, which they did, but then when my husband went to shower, the problem was back and clearly whoever they sent to fix it, did not do it well.. they told us the world cup games were broadcasted in the channels that was avaiable in the rooms, but when we got there, the channels did not show any game, so we had to call and ask for it to be fixed. Dispite the issues we had with our room, the staff were in all occasion quite helpful and freindly and offered the best they could to make it a comfortable stay for us. The only reason that would make me not recommend this hotel is the Hygine issues that we encountered. To me Hygine and cleaness comes first before location, service, quality...etc

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: emeyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albatros Hotel for 4 nights in September. We booked a premium suite which we found wonderful and enjoyed our stay their. The hotel is very cleen, has a very friendly staff, elegant rooms, and a nice breakfast area on the roof. The only thing that I didn't like about the hotel is that there are no restaurants and coffee shops nearby and transporation is difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “FELT MYSELF AT HOME”
Reviews.Author: satomoco
Reviews.Content: Located in the historic site Sltanahmet, Albatros Premier Hotel had the exact atmospher of Istanbul. Though only few minutes walk to Blue mosque and Hagia Sophia, the neighborhood of the hotel is very quiet. I heard that the hotel had just renoveted, so room was charming and everything new. I have to comment about staffs. They were very frendly and proffesional. The receptionist Mr. Tuncay was nice person. He gave us a great advise of sightseeings and arranged our transportations perfectly. We enjoyed comfortable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “istanbul & hotel staff is just great!!!”
Reviews.Author: ricardo072
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect with the most helpful and friendly staff we have ever experienced. We were made to feel like a home. The room was very clean and comfortable,free wireless internet in the room and everywhere in the hotel.The breakfast was superr - it was fresh fruit, breads, cheeses yogurt and more thinks.It is only a 5 minute walk to the Ayasofia, Blue Mosque, and all importent placeses. Especially we want to many thanks you miss. Nesrin, she gave us perfect offers about the facilities. We hope to stay albatros premier hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: summaralbasha
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my girlfriend for 4 days and enjoyed the hotel. Good location, good price..about 20 minutes from Ataturk's airport. Because Sultanahmet is touristic, restaurants tend to take advantage of tourists; however, the staff members at Albatros gave us good advice about restaurants to visit. They offered a free pick up from the airport because we were staying over 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Accettabile ma con riserva!”
Reviews.Author: alecalimero
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in this hotel and it is acceptable for a short stay in Istanbul. The position is good just close to the Blue Mosque and the city center. The hotel appearance is similar to the old Istanbul buildings made of wood. The room are quite clean and furnished with a Turkey style. Our room had a problem with the air conditioning system and every afternoon when we came back to the hotel our pillows were full of water. We asked several times to change the room before the hotel staff satisfied us. The breakfast had a lot of dishes but was poor if you prefer sweet things.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is perfect in allways.”
Reviews.Author: frida52
Reviews.Content: the breakfast was verry good.We stayed there for 5 nights and everymorning,there were other thinks on the buffettable.everything what you can think was there. The room was clean,every day clean towels.The crew was verry kindly and helpfull. The hotel s situating verry good.Taxi place in front of the door,tram in about 10 min.walking.The other things you can walk in 10 till 15 minutes.The Bosporus you can reach in 5 minutes.It,s 15 to 25 minutes from Ataturk airport,that depence off the trafic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel worth to stay in it...”
Reviews.Author: s_p_boske
Reviews.Content: .If you want to be close to everything which is important to see in Istanbul and want o be spared from trafick and noise you will for shure chose this hotel. Hotel is only few minutes of walk from all important sightseens of this city which inside itself is hiding many secrets connected for culture of all nationalitys that have created it for centuryes. Hotel is only 20 minutes away from Ataturk airport. Restorant on fourth floor is giving you most beautyful view to Marmara sea. Only few minutes of slow walk is separating you from beautyful pedestrian path next to the sea coast from hich you can see a hugh number of ships waiting for pass through Bosphor. Very kind and always ready to help hotel personel will do everithing to make your stay as plesent as possible. Hotel has frendly atmosphere and you can feel like at home. Rooms are clean and has everything to satisfy tourist or buisseness interest of their guests. High speed internet, Cable TV, Tour desk etc Hotel is satisfying very high standards of every tourist.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent location, friendly, attentive and helpful service"”
Reviews.Author: MargeKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: It is located in a fascinating part of Istanbul within walking distance of major tourist attractions like the Sultanahmet Imperial Mosque (Blue Mosque), Hagia Sophia, the Grand Bazaar and the tram line. Surrounded by literally hundreds of cafes, restaurants and shops all of which blend in with the charm of the Old Quarter of the City. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “cooperative & very friendly”
Reviews.Author: matoular
Reviews.Content: nice cooperation , friendly , ready to help even at night, excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice and Location”
Reviews.Author: Waela
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the hotel staff and hotel location, it was very good choice. The room was fairly good for the price and I would stay again in this hotel if I ever come back to Istanbul which I will. Go for it...Excellent Location...

HotelInfo.Name: Albatros Premier Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Kucukayasofya MahallesI cayIroglu sok no:1 Sultanahmet | Ä°STANBUL SULTANAHMET, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
